properties.abstract:
The second half of the normal approach to the Monte Rosa hut SAC is not a normal alpine hike, but a glacier tour: crampons, harness, rope and ice axe are essential. The approach is well marked white-blue-white, bars are placed on the glacier. With glacier shrinkage, the transition to the glacier and the route over it varies from year to year.
In summer 2019 a new route, the "Panoramaweg Monte Rosa Hütte", was added, which is about half an hour shorter.
properties.title: From Rotenboden via the Gornergletscher

sac_photos.title: On the "Panorama Trail Monte Rosa Hut
At the start of the hut path by Rotenboden
Eastward traverse, hut in the background.
View back to the unmistakable form of the Matterhorn
Soon there! The Monte-Rosa-Hütte, and the Liskamm Nordwand behind it.

segments.description:
The station at Rotenboden (2815 m) can be reached with the Gornergratbahn (railway) or on foot from Zermatt.
Follow the marked hiking path to the south, which crosses eastwards under the south flank of the Gornergrat to P. 2694. (up to here T2).
segments.title: Rotenboden - Viewpoint Gornerglescher P. 2649

segments.description: Continue over screes and follow ladders southwards down onto the Gorner Glacier, which is reached at about 2560 m A wooden bridge is used to cross the glacial stream, which is always powerful in mid-summer.  The route over the glacier is marked, the route can change depending on the season. Crampons are required, as the Gorner glacier is usually very bad early in the summer. In fresh snow or poor visibility, a rope must be used. After a few hundred meters on the glacier, turn left (SE) following markings and tracks through the moraine field to meet the Gornersee. Finally weave your way up through rock bands and glacier polished slabs to the Monte Rosa hut.

photos.caption: Over glacier scoured rock shortly before the glacier.
Discesa sul Gornergletscher, visibile il ponte per l'attraversamento del riale.

segments.title: Viewpoint Gornerglescher P. 2649 - old path - Monte-Rosa-Hütte

segments.description: The "Panoramaweg" was established in June 2019 with the help of the Civil Protection. This route leads over the northern arm of the Gornergletscher to the Monte Rosa hut with less loss of altitude. If the glacier is not completely snow-free, glacier equipment and a rope is recommended. Leave the hut trail just before P. 2649 and head east onto the northern arm of the Gornergletscher. One climbs on the glacier between two crevasse zones up to approx. 2860 m, there turn southwards. Now the path leads through scree and over slabs, finally westwards to the Monte Rosa Hut. Marked white-blue-white, T4.

photos.caption: Start of new "Monte Rosa Hut Panorama Trail".
Start of new "Monte Rosa Hut Panorama Trail".
On the "Panorama Trail Monte Rosa Hut
Crossing the stream on the "Panoramaweg Monte-Rosa-Hütte".

segments.title: "Panoramaweg Monte-Rosa-Hütte"

segments.description: From Zermatt you can walk via Winkelmatten, Moos, Riffelalp and Riffelberg to Rotenboden (3½ hours).
segments.title: Variant: On foot to Rotenboden.
